org.concordion.ext

Class StoryboardExtension

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.concordion.ext.StoryboardExtension
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.concordion.api.extension.ConcordionExtension

    public class StoryboardExtension
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.concordion.api.extension.ConcordionExtension
    The Storyboard extension provides the capability to embed a series of 'cards' containing screenshots or data (text, xml, or html) in a panel at the bottom of the specification.

    Further information can be found in the Specification.

      • addCardImage

        public void addCardImage(java.lang.String sourcePath,
                         java.lang.String filename)
        Add custom card image that will be shared by all tests, must be called before test starts otherwise this will do nothing

      • getCardImage

        public CustomCardImage getCardImage(java.lang.String filename)
        Get a previously added custom card image
        Parameters:
        filename -
        Returns:

      • setAddCardOnThrowable

        public StoryboardExtension setAddCardOnThrowable(boolean value)
        Sets whether a card will be added to the storyboard when an uncaught exception occurs in the test. Defaults to true. If screenshotTaker is set then it will take a ScreenshotCard, else it will add a NotificationCard
        Parameters:
        value - true to add a card when an uncaught exception occurs in the test, false to not add a card.

      • setAddCardOnFailure

        public StoryboardExtension setAddCardOnFailure(boolean value)
        Sets whether a card will be added to the storyboard when a failure occurs in the test. Defaults to true. If screenshotTaker is set then it will take a ScreenshotCard, else it will add a NotificationCard
        Parameters:
        value - true to add a card when a failure occurs in the test, false to not add a card.

      • setScreenshotTaker

        public StoryboardExtension setScreenshotTaker(ScreenshotTaker screenshotTaker)
        Set a screenshot taker. If not set, the extension will default to using Robot which will take a shot of the full visible screen. For a non gui application this won't be the most appropriate behaviour and you will want to set the screenshot taker to null. See the demo application for an example of a custom SeleniumScreenshotTaker.
        Parameters:
        screenshotTaker -

      • setTakeScreenshotOnCompletion

        public StoryboardExtension setTakeScreenshotOnCompletion(boolean value)
        When the test completes and the ScreenshotTaker is not null, the storyboard will take a screenshot of the current screen.
        Parameters:
        value - true to take screenshot (default), false to not take screenshot

      • setAcceptsScreenshots

        public void setAcceptsScreenshots(boolean accept)
        Set to false to stop screenshot cards being added, this is useful in situations where might be looping and refreshing screen constantly and don't want to show many screenshots of same screen in storyboard
        Parameters:
        accept -

      • addNotification

        public void addNotification(java.lang.String title,
                            java.lang.String description,
                            java.lang.String data,
                            CardImage image,
                            CardResult result)
        Adds data/information card to story board
        Parameters:
        title - short description
        description - card summary
        data - any data that may want to present to user when they click on it, can be empty, xml, json, etc

      • addNotification

        public void addNotification(java.lang.String title,
                            java.lang.String description,
                            java.lang.String data,
                            java.lang.String fileExtension,
                            CardImage image,
                            CardResult result)
        Adds data/information card to story board
        Parameters:
        title - short description
        description - card summary
        data - any data that may want to present to user when they click on it, can be empty, xml, json, etc
        fileExtension - file extension of file to write data to, defaults to txt

      • startGroup

        public void startGroup(java.lang.String title)
        Adds collapsible group card to story board
        Parameters:
        title - Must be unique for each group added

      • stopGroup

        public void stopGroup()
        Wraps all story cards from startGroup() call to last added card in a collapse/expand region (defaults to collapsed)

      • addSectionBreak

        public void addSectionBreak(java.lang.String title)
        Wraps all story cards from startGroup() call to last added card in a collapse/expand region (defaults to collapsed)
